Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2013 11:09AM pesky_LB wrote: Thank God!  :)  You must be over the moon!  Go celebrate...  go kiss that adorable baby a thousand times, and be happy.  All the best to you!
Posts.Title: Good news!! Laylalooo12 Laylalooo12

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2013 02:35AM pesky_LB wrote: Hi Freetobemebc -- I just found out today that I have pleomorphic microcalcifications (BI RADS4) - just one grouping - in my upper left quadrant as well.  Biopsy next week. What a day.  What a MONTH actually -- as I have been dodging medical bullets left and right it seems (thyroid biopsy last week, which is full of nodules - but benign, thankfully..  and 2 masses on my liver, also benign - but I need to have them removed asap).  I'm feeling that "how long can my luck hold out" feeling, to say the least.  :)  It's comforting to read that the biopsy's not too bad..  my thyroid biopsy was not pleasant, but at least I'm somewhat prepared.  Please keep us posted on what you find out....  fingers crossed.
Posts.Title: BIRADS4...Now what? freetobemebc pesky_LB

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2013 03:29AM pesky_LB wrote: Hi Gek1105... Any time something on your body is not right - whether it's a funny looking mole or a strange rash - see a doctor.  That's what they're for - even if it turns out to be nothing. I have a 19 y.o. daughter - and I would tell her what I'm going to tell you:  See a doctor.  You're right - you're young, no history of bc in your family, and most likely fit and healthy.  So any lump that appears on your breast (or anywhere) should be looked at by a physician - now.  Please don't wait. Don't be scared either -- imagine your relief when you find out that it's just a cyst or an infection... and you will be proud of yourself for taking control over YOUR health.  You have a long wonderful life ahead of you, so get this taken care of, and then you can get back to life as usual.  Ok? Go get it checked.  :)
Posts.Title: Boob indentation dicovered Gek1105 pesky_LB

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2013 01:49PM pesky_LB wrote: My biopsy was yesterday.  I actually needed TWO - which I wasn't at all prepared for (there are apparently two suspicious areas, not just the one).  And I have to say - I felt absolutely NOTHING.  The lidocaine shot was not even half as painful as a finger prick for a blood test.  Maybe I was just lucky - and my dr was just super good at shots...  :)  Who knows.  But I felt nothing for the rest of the very long procedure.  Not a thing.  In fact, I started falling asleep on the table.  I do have a bruise on my left shoulder from having to lay very still on the hard surface (I was tense at first, so that's probably why).  I had to take tylenol last night (2 extra strength) and use the ice pack .. but that nipped the pain in the bud - and I'm feeling really good.   I hope everyone can have this same positive experience I did.   Now it's just the wait of course, for the results.  I hope I'm as prepared as I think I am for any bad news I might get....  Sangria is ready.
Posts.Title: BIRADS4...Now what? freetobemebc pesky_LB
